availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer and ferryboat owner. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Unsell. Father of William Unsell, Moses Unsell, Ann Unsell, Oliver C. Unsell, Elizabeth Unsell, Mary Unsell. Farmer in Ballard County in 1850. Farmer in Ballard County in 1860. Employed John S. Pollock as a laborer in Ballard County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Ballard County in 1860. Owned a steam-powered ferryboat, the Lucy McConnell, that was seized and destroyed by U. S. soldiers in August 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, p. 295A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Tharps, p. 680.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Blandville District, p. 6.
Committee on War Claims, William H. Hughes, Administrator of David Unsell, Deceased, H. R. Rep. No. 43 (1892) (to accompany H. R. 2189), The Reports of Committees of the House of Representatives for the First Session of the Fifty-second Congress, 1891-92, (Washington, D. C.: Government Printing Office, 1892).
